word_mean: polar-orbiting meteorological satellite 又称“太阳同步气象卫星(solar synchronous meteorological satellite)” 。运行轨道近乎通过地球南北两极地区上空的气象卫星。
"又称 :高偏振星(AM Her star,AM Her binary) "
在可见区或附近光谱区具有强线偏振和强圆偏振辐射的激变双星。其一子星是以双星轨道周期同步自转的强磁场白矮星，另一是红矮星。

list.abs: 极化（polarization），指事物在一定条件下发生两极分化，使其性质相对于原来状态有所偏离的现象。如分子极化(偶极矩增大)、光之 …

偏光镜（polarizer）是摄影玩家最常用的滤镜之一，CP值相当高。它主要用于风景摄影，能过滤杂光，让拍摄主题呈现澄净、饱和的 …
5.4.1 偏振器 (Polarizer) 除了某些激光器本身即可产生线偏振光外， 除了某些激光器本身即可产生线偏振光外，大部分都是通过对入射.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from medieval Latin polaris 'heavenly', from Latin polus 'end of an axis' (see pole)

encyclopedia.content: 摘要 polar [pəulə] adj. 地级的 近地级的 极地的 完全相反的 正好相反的 【术语】磁极的。释义 1·close to or relating to the North Pole or the South Pole. 地级的，近地级的，极地的。 eg:As our climate warms up, the polar ice caps will begin to melt. 随着我们的气候逐渐变暖，极地的冰冠也将开始融化。 2·polar opposite/extreme somgthing thatisthe complete or exact opposite of something e

entry.def: Polar means near the North and South Poles.

example.ex: ...the rigours of life in the polar regions...
example.tran: 在极地地区生活的艰苦

example.ex: Warmth melted some of the polar ice.
example.tran: 温暖的天气融化了一些极地的冰雪。

entry.tran: （在性质、类型等方面）完全相反的，截然对立的
entry.def: Polar is used to describe things which are completely opposite in character, quality, or type.

example.ex: In many ways, Brett and Bernard are polar opposites.
example.tran: 在许多方面，布雷特和伯纳德截然不同。

example.ex: ...economists at polar ends of the politico-economic spectrum.
example.tran: 政治经济观点完全对立的经济学家

means.word_mean: 1. having a pair of equal and opposite charges
2. characterized by opposite extremes; completely opposed;
3. located at or near or coming from the earth's poles;
4. of or existing at or near a geographical pole or within the Arctic or Antarctic Circles;

sentences.sentence: "Its pivotal location has also exposed it to periodic invasions"- Henry Kissinger
